title: add-archive-content fails on rar:  "ERROR: Unsupported Method" - requires manual fall back to patool
body:
Happened to me on smaug with datalad 0.12.2 originally but also with current master (full WTF below):

```shell
(git)smaug:/mnt/datasets/datalad/crawl/labs/mvdm/MotivationalT-v2[master]R050
$> datalad add-archive-content --delete R050-2014-04-01_recording.rar
[INFO   ] Adding content of the archive R050-2014-04-01_recording.rar into annex <AnnexRepo path=/mnt/datasets/datalad/crawl/labs/mvdm/MotivationalT-v2 (<class 'datalad.support.annexrepo.AnnexRepo'>)> 
CommandError: '7z x /mnt/datasets/datalad/crawl/labs/mvdm/MotivationalT-v2/.git/annex/objects/j9/2X/MD5E-s1613758023--3daf9d42a83b3145c5bf36cb5955efe5.rar/MD5E-s1613758023--3daf9d42a83b3145c5bf36cb5955efe5.rar' failed with exitcode 2 under /mnt/datasets/datalad/crawl/labs/mvdm/MotivationalT-v2/.git/datalad/tmp/archives/43606e1f9f

7-Zip [64] 16.02 : Copyright (c) 1999-2016 Igor Pavlov : 2016-05-21
p7zip Version 16.02 (locale=en_US.UTF-8,Utf16=on,HugeFiles=on,64 bits,16 CPUs Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2623 v3 @ 3.00GHz (306F2),ASM,AES-NI)

Scanning the drive for archives:
1 file, 1613758023 bytes (1539 MiB)

Extracting archive: /mnt/datasets/datalad/crawl/labs/mvdm/MotivationalT-v2/.git/annex/objects/j9/2X/MD5E-s1613758023--3daf9d42a83b3145c5bf36cb5955efe5.rar/MD5E-s1613758023--3daf9d42a83b3145c5bf36cb5955efe5.rar
--
Path = /mnt/datasets/datalad/crawl/labs/mvdm/MotivationalT-v2/.git/annex/objects/j9/2X/MD5E-s1613758023--3daf9d42a83b3145c5bf36cb5955efe5.rar/MD5E-s1613758023--3daf9d42a83b3145c5bf36cb5955efe5.rar
Type = Rar
Physical Size = 1613758023
Solid = -
Blocks = 120
Multivolume = -
Volumes = 1


Sub items Errors: 120

Archives with Errors: 1

Sub items Errors: 120
ERROR: Unsupported Method : CSC5.ncs
ERROR: Unsupported Method : CSC6.ncs
ERROR: Unsupported Method : CSC7.ncs
ERROR: Unsupported Method : CSC8.ncs
ERROR: Unsupported Method : CSC9.ncs
ERROR: Unsupported Method : CSC10.ncs
...
```

adding `-c datalad.runtime.use-patool=True` resolved the issue and it extracted the content.

all data (including those archives) should be available from http://datasets.datalad.org/?dir=/labs/mvdm/MotivationalT-v2

<details><summary>DataLad 0.12.5.dev617 WTF (configuration, datalad, dataset, dependencies, environment, extensions, git-annex, location, metadata_extractors, python, system)</summary>
